```ts
class InfiniteGrid extends Component
```

<div>

</div>

<p>A module used to arrange items including content infinitely according to layout type. With this module, you can implement various layouts composed of different items whose sizes vary. It guarantees performance by maintaining the number of DOMs the module is handling under any circumstance</p>

<div className="container">
  <div className="row mb-2"><div className="col col--6"><strong>Methods</strong></div><div className="col col--6"><strong>Events</strong></div></div>
  <div className="row"><div className="col col--6"><a href="#renderItems">renderItems</a><br/><a href="#getWrapperElement">getWrapperElement</a><br/><a href="#getScrollContainerElement">getScrollContainerElement</a><br/><a href="#getContainerElement">getContainerElement</a><br/><a href="#syncItems">syncItems</a><br/><a href="#setCursors">setCursors</a><br/><a href="#getStartCursor">getStartCursor</a><br/><a href="#getEndCursor">getEndCursor</a><br/><a href="#append">append</a><br/><a href="#prepend">prepend</a><br/><a href="#insert">insert</a><br/><a href="#insertByGroupIndex">insertByGroupIndex</a><br/><a href="#getStatus">getStatus</a><br/><a href="#setPlaceholder">setPlaceholder</a><br/><a href="#setLoading">setLoading</a><br/><a href="#appendPlaceholders">appendPlaceholders</a><br/><a href="#prependPlaceholders">prependPlaceholders</a><br/><a href="#removePlaceholders">removePlaceholders</a><br/><a href="#setStatus">setStatus</a><br/><a href="#removeGroupByIndex">removeGroupByIndex</a><br/><a href="#removeGroupByKey">removeGroupByKey</a><br/><a href="#removeByIndex">removeByIndex</a><br/><a href="#removeByKey">removeByKey</a><br/><a href="#updateItems">updateItems</a><br/><a href="#getItems">getItems</a><br/><a href="#getVisibleItems">getVisibleItems</a><br/><a href="#getRenderingItems">getRenderingItems</a><br/><a href="#getGroups">getGroups</a><br/><a href="#getVisibleGroups">getVisibleGroups</a><br/><a href="#wait">wait</a><br/><a href="#ready">ready</a><br/><a href="#isWait">isWait</a><br/><a href="#destroy">destroy</a></div><div className="col col--6"><a href="#event-changeScroll">changeScroll</a><br/><a href="#event-requestAppend">requestAppend</a><br/><a href="#event-requestPrepend">requestPrepend</a><br/><a href="#event-contentError">contentError</a><br/><a href="#event-renderComplete">renderComplete</a></div></div>
</div>

## constructor
```ts
new InfiniteGrid(wrapper, options)
```

<div>

</div>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|wrapper|HTMLElement \| string|||<p>A base element for a module </p>|
|options|Options|||<p>The option object of the InfiniteGrid module </p>|

```html
<ul id="grid">
  <li class="card">
    <div>test1</div>
  </li>
  <li class="card">
    <div>test2</div>
  </li>
  <li class="card">
    <div>test3</div>
  </li>
  <li class="card">
    <div>test4</div>
  </li>
  <li class="card">
    <div>test5</div>
  </li>
  <li class="card">
    <div>test6</div>
  </li>
</ul>
<script>
import { MasonryInfiniteGrid } from "@egjs/infinitegrid";
var some = new MasonryInfiniteGrid("#grid").on("renderComplete", function(e) {
  // ...
});
// If you already have items in the container, call "layout" method.
some.renderItems();
</script>
```

## Methods

### renderItems {#renderItems}

<div>

</div>

<p>Rearrange items to fit the grid and render them. When rearrange is complete, the <code>renderComplete</code> event is fired.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|options|RenderOptions|✔️|{}|<p>Options for rendering. </p>|

```ts
import { MasonryInfiniteGrid } from "@egjs/infinitegrid";
const grid = new MasonryInfiniteGrid();

grid.on("renderComplete", e => {
  console.log(e);
});
grid.renderItems();
```

### getWrapperElement {#getWrapperElement}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns the wrapper element specified by the user.</p>

### getScrollContainerElement {#getScrollContainerElement}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns the container element corresponding to the scroll area.</p>

### getContainerElement {#getContainerElement}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns the container element containing item elements.</p>

### syncItems {#syncItems}

<div>

</div>

<p>When items change, it synchronizes and renders items.</p>

**Returns**: this

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|[InfiniteGridItemInfo](InfiniteGridItemInfo)[]|||<p>Options for rendering. </p>|

### setCursors {#setCursors}

<div>

</div>

<p>Change the currently visible groups.</p>

**Returns**: this

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|startCursor|number|||<p>first index of visible groups. </p>|
|endCursor|number|||<p>last index of visible groups. </p>|
|useFirstRender|boolean|✔️||<p>Whether the first rendering has already been done. </p>|

### getStartCursor {#getStartCursor}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns the first index of visible groups.</p>

**Returns**: number

### getEndCursor {#getEndCursor}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns the last index of visible groups.</p>

**Returns**: number

### append {#append}

<div>

</div>

<p>Add items at the bottom(right) of the grid.</p>

**Returns**: this
- <ul><br /><li>An instance of a module itself</li><br /></ul>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|InfiniteGridInsertedItems|||<p>items to be added </p>|
|groupKey|string \| number|✔️||<p>The group key to be configured in items. It is automatically generated by default. </p>|

```js
ig.append(`<div class="item">test1</div><div class="item">test2</div>`);
ig.append([`<div class="item">test1</div>`, `<div class="item">test2</div>`]);
ig.append([HTMLElement1, HTMLElement2]);
```

### prepend {#prepend}

<div>

</div>

<p>Add items at the top(left) of the grid.</p>

**Returns**: this
- <ul><br /><li>An instance of a module itself</li><br /></ul>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|InfiniteGridInsertedItems|||<p>items to be added </p>|
|groupKey|string \| number|✔️||<p>The group key to be configured in items. It is automatically generated by default. </p>|

```ts
ig.prepend(`<div class="item">test1</div><div class="item">test2</div>`);
ig.prepend([`<div class="item">test1</div>`, `<div class="item">test2</div>`]);
ig.prepend([HTMLElement1, HTMLElement2]);
```

### insert {#insert}

<div>

</div>

<p>Add items to a specific index.</p>

**Returns**: this
- <ul><br /><li>An instance of a module itself</li><br /></ul>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|index|number|||<p>index to add </p>|
|items|InfiniteGridInsertedItems|||<p>items to be added </p>|
|groupKey|string \| number|✔️||<p>The group key to be configured in items. It is automatically generated by default. </p>|

```ts
ig.insert(2, `<div class="item">test1</div><div class="item">test2</div>`);
ig.insert(3, [`<div class="item">test1</div>`, `<div class="item">test2</div>`]);
ig.insert(4, [HTMLElement1, HTMLElement2]);
```

### insertByGroupIndex {#insertByGroupIndex}

<div>

</div>

<p>Add items based on group index.</p>

**Returns**: this
- <ul><br /><li>An instance of a module itself</li><br /></ul>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|groupIndex|number|||<p>group index to add </p>|
|items|InfiniteGridInsertedItems|||<p>items to be added </p>|
|groupKey|string \| number|✔️||<p>The group key to be configured in items. It is automatically generated by default. </p>|

```ts
ig.insertByGroupIndex(2, `<div class="item">test1</div><div class="item">test2</div>`);
ig.insertByGroupIndex(3, [`<div class="item">test1</div>`, `<div class="item">test2</div>`]);
ig.insertByGroupIndex(4, [HTMLElement1, HTMLElement2]);
```

### getStatus {#getStatus}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns the current state of a module such as location information. You can use the setStatus() method to restore the information returned through a call to this method.</p>

**Returns**: [InfiniteGridStatus](InfiniteGridStatus)

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|type|STATUS_TYPE|✔️||<p>STATUS_TYPE.NOT_REMOVE = Get all information about items. STATUS_TYPE.REMOVE_INVISIBLE_ITEMS = Get information on visible items only. STATUS_TYPE.MINIMIZE_INVISIBLE_ITEMS = Compress invisible items. You can replace it with a placeholder. STATUS_TYPE.MINIMIZE_INVISIBLE_GROUPS = Compress invisible groups. </p>|
|includePlaceholders|boolean|✔️||<p>Whether to include items corresponding to placeholders. </p>|

### setPlaceholder {#setPlaceholder}

<div>

</div>

<p>You can set placeholders to restore status or wait for items to be added.</p>

**Returns**: this

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|info|Partial&lt;InfiniteGridItemStatus&gt; \| null|||<p>The placeholder status. </p>|

<div>

</div>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|

### appendPlaceholders {#appendPlaceholders}

<div>

</div>

<p>Add the placeholder at the end.</p>

**Returns**: [InsertedPlaceholdersResult](InsertedPlaceholdersResult)

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|number \| InfiniteGridItemStatus[]|||<p>Items that correspond to placeholders. If it is a number, it duplicates the number of copies. </p>|
|groupKey|string \| number|✔️||<p>The group key to be configured in items. It is automatically generated by default. </p>|

### prependPlaceholders {#prependPlaceholders}

<div>

</div>

<p>Add the placeholder at the start.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|items|number \| InfiniteGridItemStatus[]|||<p>Items that correspond to placeholders. If it is a number, it duplicates the number of copies. </p>|

### removePlaceholders {#removePlaceholders}

<div>

</div>

<p>Remove placeholders</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|type|"start" \| "end" \| {groupKey: string \| number}|||<p>Remove the placeholders corresponding to the groupkey. When &quot;start&quot; or &quot;end&quot;, remove all placeholders in that direction. </p>|

</div>

### ready {#ready}

<div>

</div>

<p>When the data request is complete, it is set to ready state.</p>

### isWait {#isWait}

<div>

</div>

<p>Returns whether it is set to wait to request data.</p>

### destroy {#destroy}

<div>

</div>

<p>Releases the instnace and events and returns the CSS of the container and elements.</p>

**Returns**: void

## Events
### changeScroll {#event-changeScroll}

<div>

</div>

<p>This event is fired when scrolling.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|e|InfiniteGrid.OnChangeScroll|||<p>The object of data to be sent to an event </p>|

### requestAppend {#event-requestAppend}

<div>

</div>

<p>The event is fired when scrolling reaches the end or when data for a virtual group is required.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|e|InfiniteGrid.OnRequestAppend|||<p>The object of data to be sent to an event </p>|

### requestPrepend {#event-requestPrepend}

<div>

</div>

<p>The event is fired when scrolling reaches the start or when data for a virtual group is required.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|e|InfiniteGrid.OnRequestPrepend|||<p>The object of data to be sent to an event </p>|

### contentError {#event-contentError}

<div>

</div>

<p>The event is fired when scrolling reaches the start or when data for a virtual group is required.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|e|InfiniteGrid.OnContentError|||<p>The object of data to be sent to an event </p>|

### renderComplete {#event-renderComplete}

<div>

</div>

<p>This event is fired when the InfiniteGrid has completed rendering.</p>

|PARAMETER|TYPE|OPTIONAL|DEFAULT|DESCRIPTION|
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
|e|InfiniteGrid.OnRenderComplete|||<p>The object of data to be sent to an event </p>|
